top_categories.workout_context: La Drômoise Gravel's French Alps, European gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
89ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Race-pace efforts that mimic La Drômoise Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
At La Drômoise Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of La Drômoise Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
5,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
5,500ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
62 miles on french Alps gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At La Drômoise Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Low-cadence force work for 5,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on french Alps gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for La Drômoise Gravel’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at La Drômoise Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at La Drômoise Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on french alps gravel to build confidence. Expect: french alps, european gravel, france.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 62 miles of french alps gravel in Drôme, France.
